file_content.text: How do you work this thing? This antiquated tech is older than--Nyranos! Company.
We'll prove our worth to the Republic.
My own men... throwing me to the Imperials for a few credits. Only a lifetime in prison will breed that kind of desperation.
But please, put down your weapon and let us speak. No one else needs to die today.
But please, put down your weapons and let us speak. No one else needs to die today.
I would have negotiated sooner, but those Imperial watch dogs wouldn't allow it.
I thought they were your allies. Why the sudden change of heart?
You're not with the Imperials?
The Empire's aims were never ours. They extended a helping hand only to catch us by the throat.
You've already lost. You don't have anything to barter with.
Why should I negotiate?
You may have killed the Imperials, but my confederates are still out there, armed and eager to fight. I'd prefer we avoided further bloodshed.
Give me one reason why I should let you live.
I ought to kill you.
Despite what the wardens may have told you, there's no need for us to be enemies. I wish only to talk.
But if words are not enough, allow me to prove my sincerity.
Attention, my fellow Condemned--this is Nyranos. Lay down your arms. It's time we resolved this... peacefully.
Stop right there, you murdering scum! You won't poison this prison anymore!
Why are you just standing there? Kill that lunatic so we can end this madness!
A Jedi never kills without reason, Graal. Let's hear what he has to say.
That's not how I do things.
Mediation is the first step toward peace, Graal.
That won't solve anything.
A good soldier knows when to fight and when to talk.
This isn't the time for that.
Uh, Graal? You're kind of ruining this whole "peaceful resolution" thing.
You need to relax.
You're not going to listen to that madman, are you? How can you just forget everything he's done?
Butt out.
If you think I'll just stand by and watch a bunch of convicts overrun my prison....
I figured you'd want to be here when he died.
I was just waiting for you.
Wait! At least hear me out.
Neither I nor any of the Condemned have ever been convicted of a crime. We merely inherited our ancestors' sentences.
All we want is our freedom--perhaps a small piece of land on Belsavis where we can live in peace. We deserve that much.
Only thing this nutcase deserves is a blaster bolt between the eyes. If you don't kill him, I will.
You've heard our demands; do what you will. Just know that I'll die before I return to that cell.
Nyranos is willing to forget the past, Graal--it's time you did the same. Do the right thing and help him settle his people.
These people are innocent.
I... yes, you're right. This has gone too far.
You'll have your freedom, Nyranos--but you're going to work for it. I expect you and your people to help us restore order here.
Agreed. And thank you for seeing reason. We will not forget this.
I'm just glad we were able to settle this without any more violence.
What a relief.
As am I.
Stay out of trouble.
We fought hard for this freedom. We're not about to squander it.
This sector is more or less secure now, but a Colonel Hauer has been asking for assistance in the high security wing.
I told him I didn't have any men to spare, but that you might be able to lend a hand. He's expecting you now.
You go on ahead--we've got things under control here. Just be careful. The innermost wings are real madhouses.
I appreciate you helping us clean up this mess. We're one step closer to getting this place under control.
You're a murderer, Nyranos. It's time you paid the price for that.
Death it is. [Kill Nyranos]
Finally... some proper justice. I hope Kelsa and Playt are smiling right now, wherever they are.
The Condemned won't be happy about this, but without Nyranos or the Imperials to lead them, they won't last long.
We'll mop them up soon enough. Remind them who's in charge around here.
Need a hand rounding up the remaining prisoners?
Want any help?
No, we can take it from here. I'm sure the guards are all anxious to crack a few heads.
My work here is done.
Looks like it. Don't know what we would have done without you.
I'll leave that to you.
It'll take some time to rally the guards after that last attack, but we'll get it done.
This sector is more or less secure now, but a Colonel Hauer has been asking for assistance in the high security wing.
I told him I didn't have any men to spare, but that you might be able to lend a hand. He's expecting you now.
You go on ahead--we've got things under control here. Just be careful. The innermost wings are real madhouses.
I appreciate you helping us clean up this mess. We're one step closer to getting this place under control.
Master Jedi--my grandfather told me of your kind. I see now his stories were true.
I'd heard one of the famed Havoc commandos was killing my men. Your reputation is well-deserved, Major.
Your infamy precedes you, Captain. Tales of your exploits have breached even these walls.
At last we meet. You've given me and my men no end of trouble.
I'm glad our paths have finally crossed.
Stand down, Nyranos. Put a stop to this madness.
Surrender now.
Never. We've come too far to just crawl back into our cells.
What's your game, Nyranos?
What do you want?
I seek only justice.
You're dead.
I expected Graal's hatred would blind him, but I'd hoped you would have more sense.
Neither I nor my comrades have committed any crime against the Republic. We will have our freedom, one way or another.
Do shut up, Nyranos. No one wants to hear another speech. Just kill this upstart.
Do shut up, Nyranos. No one wants to hear another speech. Just kill these upstarts.
We came to negotiate, Imperial. Fight your own battles.
Speak for yourself. I'll take a fistful of Imperial credits over your "crusade" any day.
At least a few of you animals know the meaning of loyalty. As for you, Nyranos, you can die with the rest.
